pr_title: [PaxosLog] Part 6b: Namespace Loader via Large Table

timeline.bodyText: For my knowledge, what is seqId?
timeline.author: jkozlowski

replies.bodyText: Yes, this is not super descriptive, I imagine it's a combination of use case and acceptor/learner?
replies.author: gmaretic

replies.bodyText: Right, yeah. The problem is that PaxosUseCase as a concept only exists in TimeLock (this project is also used by embedded services and clustered lock in large internal product), which is why I opted to be generic and just describe it as a sequence ID. It is meant to be (PaxosUseCase, Acceptor|Learner), yes.
replies.author: jeremyk-91

replies.bodyText: I think we discussed offline and went for useCase - this does run the risk of people conflating it with PaxosUseCase, but it is general enough still.
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: As in the other PR, should be 'Set'
timeline.author: gmaretic

replies.bodyText: Also would be nice if this returned Set<Client> but doesn't seem to be trivial to implement, so this is fine
replies.author: gmaretic

replies.bodyText: Changing to Set works. As discussed a full change to Set<Client> is nontrivial
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: As above, make it a set?
timeline.author: gmaretic
